alert.note: Alert for Mobile (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 19 at 6:57PM CDT until June 19 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Alabama, including the following county, Mobile. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 655 PM CDT, multiple reports of flooding have come in due to excessive rainfall this afternoon upwards of 6 to 13 inches. Flood waters are being slow to recede, and this will replace the flash flood warnings for southern Mobile County. No additional flash flooding is expected, but residual high water on roadways and low lying areas persists for the next few hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Theodore, Grand Bay, Bayou La Batre, Coden, Alabama Port, Dixon Corner, Irvington, Saint Elmo, Fowl River, Kirewakra, Laurendine, South Orchard, Delchamps, Smithport, Bayleys Corner, Belle Fontaine, Mon Louis, Faustinas, Sunny Cove and Hollingers Island.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
